Specific Details: The Wheel hosted Mary Lou McDonald, Leader of Sinn Fein, at a members meeting
DPOs Lobbied: Mary Lou McDonald|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: The Wheel hosted Mary Lou McDonald, Leader of Sinn Fein, at a members meeting
Intended Results: To ensure political party leaders have first-hand insights into the developmental needs of community and voluntary organisations
Lobbying Activities:
Matters contained in our Pre-Budget submission were discussed including the need for Government to 
•	streamline, reduce and rationalise the compliance and reporting requirements facing non-profits – this will free-up time and energy  and resources in the sector to innovate and respond to need
•	ensure that statutory funders make dedicated funds available as part of their funding lines to enable non-profits they work with to meet the costs-of-compliance they face. 
•	ensure statutory funders reverse the funding cuts initiated in 2008/2009 and ensure budgets are adequate to meet the costs of services, 
•	urgently address the unsustainable rise in insurance premiums facing charities.
•	incentivise mergers and cover the costs of mergers by providing a dedicated budget in 2019 to support mergers for those charities that wish to enter into merger arrangements with other charities.  
•	to ensure that the Department of Rural and Community Development’s strategies are fully resourced.|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Ivan Cooper, Director of Public Policy

Lobbyist Name: National Federation of Voluntary Service Providers Supporting People with Intellectual Disability
Specific Details: We highlighted the Disability Funding Crisis affecting the services to people with Intellectual Disabilities and their families; the need for pay restoration for Section 39 organisations, and the funding deficits to be addressed.
DPOs Lobbied: Charles Flanagan|Minister|Department of Justice and Equality::Mary Lou McDonald|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: We highlighted the Disability Funding Crisis affecting the services to people with Intellectual Disabilities and their families; the need for pay restoration for Section 39 organisations, and the funding deficits to be addressed.
Intended Results: We aimed to secure needed funding for disability services in Budget 2020 to support people with ID and their families
Lobbying Activities: Participated in meeting with Minister Charlie Flanagan at Muiriosa Foundation, on 3 September 2019 together with CEO Siobhan Bryan, staff members and family members supported by the organisation. We highlighted the messages of our national campaign. 3 September 2019|Meeting|1::Participated in meeting with Mary Lou McDonald TD at Muiriosa Foundation, on 25 October 2019, together with CEO Siobhan Bryan, staff members and family members supported by the organisation. We highlighted the messages of our national campaign and the need for General Election manifestos to include disability issues.|Meeting|1
Grassroots directive: We provided a one-page summary of key asks in the budget which included the drivers of the disability funding crisis and the required actions to address this. We then suggested that members set up meetings with their elected representatives, together with families and individuals supported to highlight the deficits. We asked members to ask the elected representatives to raise these issues with their parties and to seek appropriate funding in Budget 2020, and for the issues to be included in the General Election manifestos. We also advised members to share this information on social media platforms.

Specific Details: Development of public health programme to manage the high level of unaddressed hearing loss in Ireland and to consider the recommendations of a WHO report on ear and hearing care published in March 2021.
DPOs Lobbied: Stephen Donnelly|Minister|Department of Health::Mary Lou McDonald|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Róisín Shorthall|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Development of public health programme to manage the high level of unaddressed hearing loss in Ireland and to consider the recommendations of a WHO report on ear and hearing care published in March 2021.
Intended Results: Development and implementation of a national plan to manage hearing loss across the population. Such a plan would include timely access to treatment, affordable hearing aids for all, significant improvement in population health in terms of reduced cognitive decline, reduced cases of dementia and reduced prevalence of depression.
Lobbying Activities: Number of emails to the Minister for Health seeking action on this issue. |Email|2-5::Liaises with a number of public representatives who submitted PQs on this matter to the Minister for Health.|Informal communication|2-5

Specific Details: Establishment of a Suicide Prevention Authority & related Draft Legislation
DPOs Lobbied: Mary Lou McDonald|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Establishment of a Suicide Prevention Authority & related Draft Legislation
Intended Results: 3Ts identify a need for a more a co-ordinated approach to mental health & suicide prevention & propose a Suicide Prevention Authority based on a Road Safety Authority model to achieve this. This independent entity would co-ordinate education & awareness, service provision, infrastructure, research, regulation & enforcement, fiscal, partnerships & innovations. 3ts propose Draft Suicide Authority Bill to support this proposal. Proposed Bill was drafted by M O'Driscoll BL.::3ts seek Sinn Fein support for establishment of Suicide Authority / Entity and Noel Smyth of 3Ts requested meeting with Ms McDonald to further discuss.
Lobbying Activities: Email enclosed Explanatory Memorandum for proposed draft Suicide Authority Bill and requested meeting with Ms Mc Donald to discuss. |Email|1::Letter enclosed Explanatory Memorandum for proposed draft Suicide Authority Bill and sent to both Leinster House & Constituency Offices of Ms McDonald requesting meeting to discuss. |Letter|2-5

Specific Details: Request amendment to Legislation
DPOs Lobbied: Mary Lou McDonald|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Request amendment to Legislation
Intended Results: To raise the viability of services due to the impact of the legislative changes introduced by section 1008A TCA 1997 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 2023. These changes will have a detrimental impact GPCareForAll. The charity runs GP practices in areas of deprivatio; deprived populations do not present an attractive investment proposition for GPs or commercial organisations.We are requesting an urgent amendment to the legislation to exempt charities like GPCareForAll from these provisions.
Lobbying Activities: Email requesting meeting |Email|1::Meeting with Deputy McDonalds representative requesting meeting |Meeting|1
